body:
Hi Mike,


this looks strange - indeed! The first glare source has an error in the 
x-y location (nan). There was on older version of evalglare (1.00-1.02), 
which had some problems when one pixel of a glare source was located 
directly at the border. but this is fixed for the current version.
What version of evalglare (type evalglare -v) are you using and what 
fish-eye type is used for the image?
Can you send me such an hdr (not to the group, directly to my email 
adress jan.wienold at ise.fraunhofer.de).


Jan
